intro: Machaeranthera eradiata, commonly known as the pink evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, winged seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Machaeranthera eradiata is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological role.
